page.title: 19WELBURY WOMEN'S EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Living in a small village presents problems for women who have children and who also wish to work.Opportunities for employment within the village are limited although some wives keep the accounts for self-employed family businesses, help on the family farm or do domestic work.There is one full time female farmer.The use of home computers has recently allowed women to undertake computer work from home.Women without children or with older children follow careers outside the village whereas those with young children favour part-time work or work from home.To work outside the village personal transport is neccessary and running costs must be set against remuneration.Despite difficulties some of the jobs are:teaching,local govt., physicist,secretarial,shop work,health
